alert.note: Alert for Mercer; Summers; Western Greenbrier (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 17 at 4:35AM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A LINE OF SHOWERS WITH GUSTY WINDS AND BRIEF HEAVY RAINFALL WILL AFFECT SMYTH...TAZEWELL...BLAND...WYTHE...WESTERN GREENBRIER... SUMMERS AND MERCER COUNTIES THROUGH 515 AM EST... At 432 AM EST, radar indicated showers were located along a line extending from near Summersville to near Wenonah to Broadford. Movement was east at 55 mph. Winds in excess of 40 mph are possible with these showers along with brief heavy rainfall. The combination of strong wind gusts and saturated ground from recent and ongoing rainfall may blow down a few trees and result in scattered power outages or blocked roadways. Brief heavy rainfall may quickly fill drainage ditches and result in minor flooding in low-lying and normally flood prone areas. Motorists should use extreme caution while driving through these areas over the next hour or so and be alert for areas of high water and potentially downed trees and/or power lines. Locations impacted include... Bluefield... Wytheville... Bland... Princeton... Marion... Tazewell... and Hinton.
